result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarrad M Gaede was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other probation now serving

miscConds.notes: Court costs have been paid in full out of bond on file.
Must enroll in and successfully complete a GED or HSED as directed by your probation agent.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  The provider is to be determined by DOC.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment agent deems appropriate.  Provider is to be deternined by DOC.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant must submit to random urinalyis by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly licensed in the State of Wisconsin.  You shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person with Dana C.

If agent deems appropriate you must submit to and successfully complete a mental health evaluation and must comply with any recommended treatment, counseling, or programming.  Defendant must execute all releases of information for assessments, counseling, treatment, to allow probation agent to verify compliance.  When your agent deems appropriate you must write a letter to Officer Goodness regarding the wrongfulness of your conduct and how drug use caused your poor judgment.  You must comply with any other recommendations of your probation agent.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate, especially AODA and mental health, by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.
Must comply with any other recommendations of agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarrad M Gaede

defendant.name: Gaede, Jarrad M
defendant.address: PO Box 241, Black River Falls, WI 54615-0241

records.addlTxt: from DOC
of Sentencing after revocation 5-22-2019

Defendant appears in person in custody with Counsel SPD Amanda Roush.  Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  19CF32 - may also address prelim.  

Attorney Roush states they will waive the prelim on 19CF32.  State indicates they are in compliance with victim rights notification.  Court performs colloquy with defendant regarding his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds he freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Bound over for trial.  Information will be e-filed.  Defense waives reading and he enters NGP's to all charges.  The 7 civil citations are to continue to track.  Court enters NGP's and sets PTC for 6-12 and STC for 7-8-19 at 3 p.m.  The prelim can be removed from calendar.

SEHR - 14CF96, Count 3:  State is in compliance with victim notification.  Attorney Roush notes that he did complete his HSED during term of probation early.  Also completed the AODA assessment and followed through with recommended treatment.  
State indicates there is no victim impact statement.  Recommends a bifurcated sentence of 6 years with 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision with 682 days of credit.  Defense states this is a joint recommendation of  6 years, but with 2 years initial confinement and 4 years extended supervision.  Agrees to the 682 days sentence credit.  Defendant exercises his right to allocution.

Court orders a bifurcated sentence of 6 years with 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision with conditions:  Risk and needs assessment and comply with recommendations including mental health screening, AODA screenings.  Not to possess any drugs, etc.  If DNA not on file must submit a sample.  (Per jail today, he has DNA on file.)  Judgment for unpaid financial obligations.  (All costs were previously paid in full.)
Granted 682 days sentence credit. Eligible for ERP and CIP.

ADDRESS INFO for Jarrad M Gaede
Current: PO Box 241, Black River Falls, WI 54615-0241 United States  (Effective: 04-25-2019)
Prior: W11916 Town Creek Rd., Black River Falls, WI 54615
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 22, 2019 at 10:15 am.
District Attorney Daniel S. Diehn appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Roush. Set for sentencing after revocation hearing.
Status conference on April 15, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Roush. Victim notification complied with.  Parties have the revocation packet.  Defense not prepared to proceed with sentencing after revocation hearing today.  Will be applying for treatment court on his new case.  STC set for 4/15 at 3 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 15, 2019 at 02:45 pm.
SEHR rescheduled at request of SPD Amanda Roush due to a scheduling conflict.
Amanda Roush
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 6, 2019 at 10:15 am.

Corrected assessment report.
Associated with Charge #3

Defendant appeared with counsel James Ritland.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  1 minor change/correction was noted in the PSI by each counsel.  DA recommends 5 years probation with conditions and 1-2 years jail as a condition of probation.  Attorney Ritland requests Court accept DOC's recommendation.  Defendant speaks.  Court orders:  14CF96 Ct 2 - sentence withheld and placed on 3 years probation; Ct 3 - sentence withheld and placed on probation for 5 years and 1 year jail as a condition of probation; Ct 4 - sentence withheld and placed on 1 year probation.  On 14CF95 Court orders on Ct 4 - sentence is withheld and placed on 1 year probation. All probation terms are concurrent.  Must report to jail on or before February 23, 2015 by 6:00 p.m.  If found to be violating any of the probation conditions prior to reporting to jail defendant is to be incarcerated immediately.  Court ordered 193 days sentence credit only to be applied if probation is revoked.  Other probation conditions are:  If agent deems appropriate you must submit to and successfully complete a mental health evaluation and must comply with any recommended treatment, counseling, or programming.  Defendant must execute all releases of information for assessments, counseling, treatment, to allow probation agent to verify compliance.  When your agent deems appropriate you must write a letter to Officer Goodness regarding the wrongfulness of your conduct and how drug use caused your poor judgment.  Must submit to a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.  Must comply with any other recommendations of your probation agent.  Defendant is not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant must submit to random urinalysis by probation agent or any law enforcement officer. The provider is to be determined by DOC.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer.  Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request. Copy of PSI sent to Judge today and verified that DA does already have a copy.
Sentencing hearing at 02-16-2015 01:30 pm
Defendant appeared with counsel James Ritland.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Sentencing rescheduled to 2-16 at 1:30.
sent copy of PSI to Judge for review.

This bond includes cases 14CF95 and 14CF96:  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. Not to leave the state of Wisconsin without the Courts approval. Curfew 9:00 p.m. - 6:00 a.m..   Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: victim Greg S. or his residence.  Amended 12-08-14:  Must report to PSI writer immediately as requested.
NO appearance by defendant.  Attorney James Ritland appeared on behalf of defendant.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Request to change bond denied.

Defendant appeared in custody from Jackson County Jail with attorney Jim Ritland present.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Judge reviewed plea questionnaire, rights, charges & penalties and elements with defendant.  Defendant pled to Counts 2, 3, 4.  Will be set for sentencing and PSI ordered.  Cash bond was reduced and conditions amended.

Defendant appeared in custody with his attorney James Ritland.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  State has requested PSI.  Court reviews plea questionnaire, rights, charges, elements, and penalties with defendant.   Pleas and waiver of rights accepted.  PSI is due in 45 days.
